today_in_history_posts.title: CheckSigFromStack for Arithmetic Values
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Jeremy Rubin introduced a lamport signature technique using binary expansion for arithmetic values.
- His blog shares the method with python code and bitcoin script translation.
- The technique is applicable in bonding contracts albeit bulky and costly, ensuring single-use signatures.

today_in_history_posts.title: bLIPs: A proposal for community-driven app layer and protocol extension standardization
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Ryan Gentry proposed bLIPs for Lightning Network standardization on the Lightning-dev list.
- bLIPs aim to organize app layer best practices and complement BOLTs without altering them.
- The initiative seeks community-driven standardization with volunteers as editors, similar to BIPs.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability aims for 1 billion weekly users via 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks."- These entities range from federated sidechains to Chaumian ecash banks, enhancing transaction efficiency.
- Research focuses on alternatives like Coinpools and optimizing UTXO storage without increasing block size.
